headline.main: NEW-YORK CITY.; The Board of Supervisors. Commissioners of Health. Commissioners of Emigration. The Gold Box Committee. Advance Wages.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Board of Supervisors met yesterday afternoon, Supervisor BLUNT in the Chair. The first document read was the following from the Comptroller, which was called for by a resolution of the Board, passed at a former meeting. It is an additional TAX LEVY FOR 1857.

headline.main: From Laguna.; VOMITO AT YEVA CRUZ AND CAMPEACHY-- A REVOLUTION ON A SMALL SCALE--THREE MEXICAN WAR VESSELS SOLD.

docs.lead_paragraph: By the Brig Isaac Career, PARTRIDGE, master we have dates from Laguna to the 25th of June. The health of the place was very good at the above date. There was no sickness whatever in the vicinity of Laguna. The vomito had made its appearance at Vera Cruz and Campeachy.
docs.snippet: By the Brig Isaac Career, PARTRIDGE, master we have dates from Laguna to the 25th of June. The health of the place was very good at the above date. There was no sickness whatever in the vicinity of Laguna. The vomito had made its appearance at Vera...

headline.main: The Telegraph Cable--Letter from Captain Hudson.

docs.lead_paragraph: From the Union of Wednesday. We copy the following letter, received yesterday morning by the Secretary of the Navy: UNITED STATES STEAM FRIGATE NIAGARA, LIVERPOOL, Saturday, July 4, 1857. Sin: I have the honor to report that we have now coiled on board this ship three hundred and ten miles of the telegraphic wire.

docs.lead_paragraph: BROOKLYN BOARD OF HEALTH.--An adjourned meeting of this Board was held yesterday afternoon The special business before the Board was the bone. boiling establishments in the Ninth Ward. Some testi mony was taken, the general tenor of which was, that the nuisance complained of did not proceed from the establishment of Messrs. SCHWANWEDLE CO , (thelargestt in the Ward,) but from others in the vicinity,

docs.lead_paragraph: To the Editor of the New-York Daily Times: I have been reflecting some what upon the wrongs of the Staten Islanders with regard to the New Quarantine, and I must say that I am filled with a "righteous indignation" in their cause.
docs.snippet: To the Editor of the New-York Daily Times: I have been reflecting some what upon the wrongs of the Staten Islanders with regard to the New Quarantine, and I must say that I am filled with a "righteous indignation" in their cause.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Commissioners of Health met at 12 M. yesterday, at the City Library, City Hall. An application was presented from the owners of the Lucy Atwood, asking permission to send her from the lower Quarantine anchorage up to the City.
docs.snippet: The Commissioners of Health met at 12 M. yesterday, at the City Library, City Hall. An application was presented from the owners of the Lucy Atwood, asking permission to send her from the lower Quarantine anchorage up to the City.

docs.lead_paragraph: We publish, in another part of this morning's impression, Governor WALKER'S recent proclamation to the people of Kansas. The occasion of this proclamation, as we have been already informed by telegraph, was the resistance of the Free-StateParty to the Territorial laws. Governor WALKER

headline.main: NEW-YORK CITY.; What Has Been Done in the Last Six Months. SHIP-BUILDING AT NEW-YORK. A Very Old Veteran. Sunday Trading. Rarly Closing of Wholesale Stores on Saturdays. The Foreign Military Companies.

docs.lead_paragraph: The exceeding dullness which has for several months pervaded the ship. building business has already attracted a large share of attention from the public generally, as well as fr om these who have a direct interest in the matter, and has been the subject ofextended comment by the Press.

headline.main: LATEST INTELLIGENCE; The East Indian Insurrection--Gen. Wool and Gen. Walker--Secretary Davis' Instructions--Appointment of Navy Pursers, &c. By Telegraph to the N. Y. Daily Times. Magnetic Telegraph Co.'s Offices--48 Wall-st, and 181 Broadway. FROM WASHINGTON.

docs.lead_paragraph: From the general and exterded insurrection in India, it is believed that Persia and China wore instigators to the revolt. Advices from the American Consul at Rio Janeiro to the 12th ult. state that the yellow fever had subsided. For the last six weeks two persons only had died on board American vessels. The city was perfectly healthy.
